result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robyn K. Gravitter

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Robyn K. Gravitter in court with attorney Alexander Paul Seifert.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 16CM20 & 16CM194.  Agreement.  Def has paid restitution in 16CM20, State moves to dismiss.  16CM194 Def to enter plea to both counts.  Probation, counseling, cost.  Def agree to plea agreement.  Plea questionnaire form completed and reviewed.  16CM194 - Ct 1 No contest  Ct 2 - No contest plea.  16CM20 Dismissed and read in.  Constitutional rights, right to jury trial and elements reviewed.  Court finds def understands charges, penalties and rights.  Pleas entered freely & voluntarily.  Factual basis set forth in complaint.  Court will accepts pleas, found guilty Ct 1 & 2.  Sentencing arguments presented by State.  Atty Seifert presents sentencing arguments.  Statement by def.   Court will order Ct 1 18 months probation AODA and follow through with recommendations.  Cooperate with Social services.  Cost & DNA surcharge.  Ct 2 - Sentence withheld probation 18 months, cost & DNA surcharge.  Counseling.  No credit .  DNA sample  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.   Post conviction rights   Victim rights have been complied with

Defendant Robyn K. Gravitter in court with attorney Alexander Paul Seifert.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 16CM20 and 16CM194 @ 3:22 p.m. Atty Seifert advises of status. Copy of complaint in 16CM194 received, reading waived, reserve juris. objections and not guilty pleas to both cts. Court receives pleas and directs entry into record. Both files set for status conf. State heard on bond for 16CM194. Def does not have to appear for status unless instructed to by Atty Seifert.  Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Robyn K. Gravitter in court with attorney Gary Stephen Dodge.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 9:11 am.  Court will grant adjournment.  Def. needs to pay restitution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 19, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Arrest Warrant issued by DA in error, original destroyed by DA
